content: If you disable this application, all active consents and authorization will be revoked. If necessary, you can enable the disabled application later.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message when disabling an OAuth application. The message informs users that revoking active consents and authorization will occur if the application is disabled. It appears in a dialog modal.

usage.context:
<ModalDialog.Body>
 <Text style={{ marginBottom: "16px" }}>
 {isGroup ? (
 <Trans t={t} i18nKey="DisableApplicationsDescription" ns="OAuth" />
 ) : (
 <Trans t={t} i18nKey="DisableApplicationDescription" ns="OAuth" />
 )}
 </Text>
 
 <Trans t={t} i18nKey="DisableApplicationNote" ns="OAuth" />
 </ModalDialog.Body>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "active consents" is not accurately translated. "Active consents" implies user-granted permissions. While "الأذونات النشطة" (al-azhunaat an-nashita) is technically 'active permissions,' it doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'consents' in an OAuth context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more precise translation that reflects the concept of user consent, such as: "إذا قمت بتعطيل هذا التطبيق، فسيتم إلغاء جميع الموافقة والتصاريح النشطة." (Idha qumta bi ta'teel hatha al-tatbeeq, fasayyam ilga'u jami' al-muwafaqa wal-tasareeh an-nashita.) – This translates to 'If you disable this application, all active authorizations will be revoked.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "authorization" is not accurately translated. المصادقة (al-musadaqa) primarily means 'authentication.' While related to authorization, it doesn't convey the full scope of 'authorization' in an OAuth context which involves permissions and access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "المصادقة" (al-musadaqa) with a more appropriate term like "التصاريح" (al-tasareeh) which means 'authorizations' or 'permissions', especially in the context of OAuth. Alternatively, use a combined term if clarity requires it (as suggested in the previous point).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "active consents" is not accurately translated. "ການຕົກລົງຮັບອະນຸຍາດທັງໝົດທີ່កំពុងເຮັດຢູ່" literally translates to 'all consents that are being done', which is awkward. A more accurate translation would convey the sense of ongoing or current authorizations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a phrase like "ການອະນຸຍາດທີ່កំពុងໃຊ້ງານอยู่" (ongoing authorizations) or "ການຕົກລົງຮັບອະນຸຍາດທີ່ເປີດໃຊ້ງານຢູ່" (active consents).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'revoked' is not directly translated. 'ຍົກເລີກ' means 'to cancel' or 'to revoke', but the nuance of 'revoked' as a legal or formal action might be missing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: While 'ຍົກເລີກ' is acceptable, consider exploring more specific terms if the context requires emphasizing the formal nature of the revocation. However, in many cases, 'ຍົກເລີກ' is sufficient.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "If necessary" is translated as "ຖ້າມີຄວາມຈໍາເປັນ".  While grammatically correct, it's a bit wordy. A more concise option would improve the flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a simpler alternative like "ຖ້າຕ້ອງການ" (if needed) or just remove it, as the meaning is implied.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'authorization' is somewhat stiff and less common in Latvian in this context. A more natural translation would be 'apstiprinājumi' (approvals) or 'pieejas tiesības' (access rights).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ja atspējosiet šo pieteikumu, visas aktīvās piekrišanas un apstiprinājumi/pieejas tiesības tiks atsauktas.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'lietojumprogrammu' is technically correct for 'application', 'ieteikums' or 'aplikācija' are often preferred in modern Latvian usage, particularly in technical contexts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ja atspējosiet šo pieteikumu, visas aktīvās piekrišanas un autorizācija tiks atsauktas. Ja nepieciešams, atspējoto ieteikumu/aplikāciju varat iespējot vēlāk.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'යෙදුම' (yeduma) appears multiple times. While technically correct, in this context, 'අප්ලිමාව' (application) might be more suitable for consistency and clarity, especially for a technical setting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing 'යෙදුම' with 'අප්ලිමාව' (application) for improved clarity.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure 'ක්‍රියාත්මක සියලු කැමැත්තම් සහ අවසර අහෝසි වනු ඇත' is grammatically correct but could be slightly improved for flow. A more natural phrasing might use a passive construction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to: 'සියලු ක්‍රියාත්මක කැමැත්තම් සහ අවසර අහෝසි කරනු ලැබේ' (All active consents and authorizations are revoked).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'autorizacija' is a direct transliteration of 'authorization' and might sound unnatural in Serbian. While technically correct, 'odobrenje' is a more common and natural term for 'authorization' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ako onemogućite ovu aplikaciju, svi aktivni pristanaci i odobrenja će biti opozvani.
